Function.Description: The nadd function is a built-in function that adds numeric operands and returns a numeric value.

Brief.Overview: The nadd function is a built-in function that adds numeric operands and returns a numeric value. The operands are not checked and are not coerced. An argument of type Void is treated as a Number.
Brief.Usage: The nadd built-in function is a simple, but very fast numeric addition function that assumes all of its arguments are type Number. Use the nadd function for highly optimized numeric addition. For a slower, but more general addition that performs type conversion, use the addition operator, +, (plus sign).

Syntax.Return: Returns the sum of all of the operands expressed as a Number.
